data.title: RJ-plots: Automated objective classification of 2D structures
data.name: RJplots
data.description: A Python package allowing for the automated and objective classification of 2D structures using a moments of inertia based method. This method is a further development of J-plots (https://github.com/SJaffa/Jplots)

evidence: "RJ-plots is a Python module which uses a moments of inertia method to disentangle a 2D structure's elongation..." (indicates a Python module/library, i.e., dependency artifact)

"An example script is provided which shows how to use the package. It calculates the RJ-values for 4 basic shapes and plots the corresponding RJ-plot, as well as provides the classification of the shapes." (direct analysis/classification of scientific structures)
"The code is open-source and can be downloaded here." with GitHub context and no mention of package managers or binaries (implies distribution via source repository)
